DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate if antibiotic therapy is necessary for treatment of uncomplicated colonic diverticulitis. The hypothesis is that Patients with acute uncomplicated colonic diverticulitis will recover the condition without antibiotic therapy and the lack of antibiotic therapy will not lead to complications. The patients will be randomized to conservative treatment with and without antibiotic therapy.
DOC.brief_title: Antibiotic Therapy of Acute Uncomplicated Colonic Diverticulitis
DOC.criteria: adults with CT sign of acute colonic uncomplicated diverticulitis elevated CRP and LPK Temp.38c or more patients with peritonitis, sepsis or CT sign of complicated diverticulitis with abscesses or free abdominal air pregnancy immunological incompetence and immunosuppressive therapy
